intro: Epidendrum latro, commonly known as the showy epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its pendulous, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质 (leathery), often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Epidendrum latro is prized in horticulture for its striking floral display and relatively easy care requirements.
